S.I. No. 290 of 2023 

ANIMAL HEALTH (IDENTIFICATION AND TRACING) REGULATIONS 
2023 

I, CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, Minister for Agriculture, Food and the 
Marine, in exercise of the powers conferred on me by section 36 of the Animal 
Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013), and having regard to Article 
269 of Regulation (EU) 2016/429 of the European Parliament and of the 
Council of 9 March 20161, hereby make the following regulations: 

Part 1: Preliminary and general 

Citation
text_norm: 7 penal provision 290 3 s.i no 290 2023 animal health (identification tracing) regulation 2023 charlie mcconalogue minister agriculture food marine exercise power conferred section 36 animal health welfare act 2013 (no 15 2013) regard article 269 regulation (eu) 2016 429 european parliament council 9 march 20161 hereby make following regulation part 1 preliminary general citation

title: ANIMAL HEALTH (IDENTIFICATION AND TRACING) REGULATIONS
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Animal Health (Identification
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Animal Health (Identification 

and Tracing) Regulations 2023. 

Definitions
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited animal health (identification tracing) regulation 2023 definition

title: ANIMAL HEALTH (IDENTIFICATION AND TRACING) REGULATIONS
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations-
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations- 

“Act” means Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013; 

“Regulation 2016/429“ means Regulation (EU) 2016/429 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 9 March 2016; 

“Regulation 2019/2035” means Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 
2019/2035 of 28 June 20192, as amended by Commission Delegated 
Regulation (EU) 2020/1625 of 25 August 20203 and Commission Delegated 
Regulation (EU) 2021/2168 of 21 September 20214; 

“Regulation 2021/520” means Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 
2021/520 of 24 March 20215 (as amended by Commission Implementing 
Regulation (EU) 2021/1064 of 28 June 2021)6; 

“relevant animal” means an animal of the bovine, ovine or porcine species. 

(2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and that is also 
used in Regulation 2016/429, Regulation 2019/2035 or Regulation 2021/520 
has, unless the contrary intention appears, the same meaning in these 
Regulations that it has in Regulation 2016/429, Regulation 2019/2035 or 
Regulation 2021/520. 

1 OJ L 84, 31.3.2016, p. 1 
2 OJ L 314, 5.12.2019, p. 115 
3 OJ L 366, 4.11.2020, p. 1 
4 OJ L 438, 8.12.2021, p. 38 
5 OJ L 104, 25.3.2021, p. 39 
6 OJ L 229, 29.6.2021, p. 8 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 9th June, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [290] 

Application

title: ANIMAL HEALTH (IDENTIFICATION AND TRACING) REGULATIONS
heading: 3. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), these Regulations apply to a relevant
text_raw:
3. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), these Regulations apply to a relevant 

animal born after the making of these Regulations. 

(2) A person may, in accordance with these Regulations, identify a relevant 
animal born before the making of these Regulations, and, where he or she does 
so, these Regulations apply to that relevant animal in place of the 
corresponding provisions of the European Union (Animal Identification and 
Tracing) Regulations 2023. 

(3) For the avoidance of doubt, provisions contained in the European 
Union (Animal Identification and Tracing) Regulations 2023 specifying time 
periods for the application of means of identification apply to the means of 
identification referred to in Parts 3 and 4 of these Regulations. 

Part 2: Bovine animals 

Bovine passports
text_norm: 3 (1) subject paragraph (2) regulation apply relevant animal born making regulation (2) person may accordance regulation identify relevant animal born making regulation regulation apply relevant animal place corresponding provision european union (animal identification tracing) regulation 2023 (3) avoidance doubt provision contained european union (animal identification tracing) regulation 2023 specifying time period application mean identification apply mean identification referred part 3 4 regulation part 2 bovine animal bovine passport

title: ANIMAL HEALTH (IDENTIFICATION AND TRACING) REGULATIONS
heading: 4. (1) The Minister may, for each bovine animal which is required to be
text_raw:
4. (1) The Minister may, for each bovine animal which is required to be 
identified in accordance with Article 112 of Regulation 2016/429, issue a 
passport or cause a passport to be issued in respect of the bovine, in a format 
approved by the Minister, within 14 days of the notification of its birth, or, in 
the case of animals imported into the State, within 14 days of the notification 
of its re-identification. 

(2) A person shall not, without lawful authority, have possession or control 

of a bovine– 

(a) 

aged 27 days old or more, or 

(b) under 27 days if it has been moved from the establishment of 

birth, 

unless the person has possession or control of the passport for the bovine. 

(3) A person shall not move a bovine unless the bovine is accompanied by 

its passport. 

(4) An operator of an establishment shall complete 

the passport 
immediately on arrival and prior to departure of each bovine from an 
establishment. 

(5) In the case of the death of a bovine– 

(a) 

(b) 

if the bovine is sent to the slaughterhouse, the operator of the 
slaughterhouse shall return the passport to the Minister, or 

in all other cases, the passport shall be returned by the operator 
to the Minister 

within seven days after the death of the bovine. 

(6) In the case of a bovine being exported from the State, the passport shall 
be surrendered by the last operator to the Minister at the place where the 
bovine is exported from. 

 
 
 
 [290] 5 

(7) A passport remains the property of the Minister and shall be produced 

for inspection or surrendered on request to an authorised officer. 

(8) An authorised officer may for the purposes of this Regulation issue a 
permit and may attach such terms and conditions to it as he or she considers 
appropriate. 

(9) In this Regulation, “passport” means a record of bovine birth 

registration issued by the Minister. 

Part 3: Ovine animals 

Ovine animals intended for direct slaughter in the State

title: ANIMAL HEALTH (IDENTIFICATION AND TRACING) REGULATIONS
heading: 5. (1) An operator keeping an ovine referred to in Article 45(1) of
text_raw:
5. (1) An operator keeping an ovine referred to in Article 45(1) of 
Regulation 2019/2035 that is intended to be moved directly to a slaughterhouse 
before the age of 12 months shall, in place of the requirements of Article 45(1) 
of Regulation 2019/2035 for such animal to be identified by either a 
conventional ear tag or conventional pastern band, ensure that each ovine is 
identified by at least a single electronic identification device displaying - 

(a) 

the unique registration number of the establishment of birth of 
the animal, and 

(b) 

the identification code of the animal. 

(2) In 

this Regulation, “electronic 

identification device” means an 
electronic ear tag as listed in point (c) of Annex III to Regulation 2019/2035, 
that conforms to the technical specifications set down in Parts 1 and 2 of 
Annex II to Regulation 2021/520 and that is approved by the Minister for an 
ovine in accordance with those Regulations and the European Union (Animal 
identification and tracing) Regulations 2023. 

Part 4: Porcine animals 

Porcine animal identification tagging
text_norm: 5 (1) operator keeping ovine referred article 45(1) regulation 2019 2035 intended moved directly slaughterhouse age 12 month shall place requirement article 45(1) regulation 2019 2035 animal identified either conventional ear tag conventional pastern band ensure ovine identified least single electronic identification device displaying - (a) unique registration number establishment birth animal (b) identification code animal (2) regulation electronic identification device mean electronic ear tag listed point (c) annex iii regulation 2019 2035 conforms technical specification set part 1 2 annex ii regulation 2021 520 approved minister ovine accordance regulation european union (animal identification tracing) regulation 2023 part 4 porcine animal porcine animal identification tagging

title: ANIMAL HEALTH (IDENTIFICATION AND TRACING) REGULATIONS
heading: 6. (1) An operator of an establishment keeping a porcine referred to in
text_raw:
6. (1) An operator of an establishment keeping a porcine referred to in 
Article 52(1) of Regulation 2019/2035 shall, in addition to the requirements of 
that Article for such animal to be identified by a particular means of 
identification– 

(a) where the porcine is moving other than to slaughter– 

(i) 

identify the porcine with a conventional ear tag in the left 
ear displaying the unique registration number of the 
establishment of birth of the porcine, and 

(ii) where the porcine has been moved from the establishment 
of birth (other than to an establishment within the same 
supply chain), identify the porcine with an additional 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [290] 

conventional ear tag in the right ear, displaying the 
registration number of the establishment of residence, or 

(b) where the porcine is a breeding animal– 

(i) 

identify the porcine with a conventional ear tag in the left 
ear displaying the unique registration number of the 
establishment of birth and a unique animal identification 
number issued in a format determined by the Minister, and 

(ii) where the porcine has been moved from the establishment 
of birth (other than to an establishment within the same 
supply chain), identify the porcine with an additional 
conventional ear tag in the right ear displaying the unique 
registration number of the establishment of residence and 
a unique animal identification number issued in a format 
determined by the Minister. 

(2) In this Regulation: 

“conventional ear tag” means an ear tag as listed in point (a) of Annex III to 
Regulation 2019/2035, that conforms to the technical specifications set down 
in Part 1 of Annex II to Regulation 2021/520 and that is approved by the 
Minister for a porcine animal in accordance with those Regulations and the 
European Union (Animal Identification and Tracing) Regulations 2023; 

“establishment of birth” includes, where a supply chain has been approved by 
the Minister under the European Union (Animal Identification and Tracing) 
Regulations 2023, the last establishment of the supply chain of birth. 

Part 5: Penalties 

Penal provisions

title: ANIMAL HEALTH (IDENTIFICATION AND TRACING) REGULATIONS
heading: 7. Regulations 4(2)(3)(4)(5)(6) and (7), 5(1), and 6(1) are penal provisions
text_raw:
7. Regulations 4(2)(3)(4)(5)(6) and (7), 5(1), and 6(1) are penal provisions 

to which section 36 (4) (a) of the Act applies. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

1 June, 2023. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [290] 7

title: ANIMAL HEALTH (IDENTIFICATION AND TRACING) REGULATIONS
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

The regulations provides for requirements in relation to livestock traceability 
including the need for a bovine passport and the electronic identification of 
sheep going directly to slaughter. 

 
 
 
 
 
 8 [290]
